questions.question_text: When deploying VMWare ESXi on Cisco UCS B-Series Servers, what should the iSCSI boot-from-SAN use in the service profile to provide redundancy?

choices.C: two vmnics to connect to the storage
choices.A: two VMKs to connect to the storage
choices.B: two vHBAs to connect to the storage
choices.D: two vNICs to connect to the storage

comments.content: I thought that according to the document you can make OTV and VXLAN work together, but Otv is not a *feature* of VXLAN so i suppose AC is still correct

discussion.content:
Excuse me.
Correct Answer: AD
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus7000/sw/vxlan/config/cisco_nexus7000_vxlan_config_guide_8x/cisco_nexus7000_vxlan_config_guide_8x_chapter_01001.pdf

questions.question_text: Which two features are supported by VXLAN on the Cisco NX-OS platform? (Choose two.)

choices.B: storage VDC for FCoE traffic and a VDC for Ethernet traffic
choices.C: two storage VDCs for FCoE traffic

questions.question_text: Which components share a physical interface in a VDC deployment?

choices.A: Enable src-dst-ox-id load balancing on the MDS switches
choices.C: Change the MDS port-channel configuration to source-dest-port
choices.B: Enable src-dst-id load balancing on the MDS switches
choices.D: Upgrade the bandwidth for the devices connected to the MDS

questions.question_text:
Your Cisco UCS design contains this hardware:
✑ 2 x 6248UP Fabric Interconnects
✑ 1 x 5108 Chassis containing a pair of 2204XP IO Modules
✑ 8 x B200M3 blades, each with a VIC 1240 and no mezzanine adapter
What is the maximum available bandwidth per fabric for each server?

discussion.content: If the VIC can support up to 40Gbps, the FEX can support up to 40Gbps too, why not C? maybe i am missing something else
